page.title: 08St Catherine's Hospice
page.content: St Catherine's Hospice first belonged o the Dewhurst family, who also owned the cotton mill in Lostock Lane. In l92l they gave the house to Preston Royal Infirmary as a convalescent hospital. It was opened in 1922. In the out buildings they grew vegetables also kept pigs and hens. The profits went to the hospital funds. They also kept guinea pigs which were used in the laboratory. During the 1930s they held a concert every Saturday night. In July 1948, the National Health Act was passed, and many years later it stopped taking children till finally only ladies were accepted. Dame Cecily Saund decided to buy the Hospice. Now eighteen personnel work there attending to the needs of terminally sick, twenty four in all.
